intro: Poterium alveolatum, commonly known as the hollowleaf mallow, is a flowering plant native to the southern United States. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant is characterized by its palmate leaves with rounded lobes and showy, pink to purple flowers that bloom in summer. Its unique structure features a hollow stem and fibrous roots, which aid in water retention in arid environments. Poterium alveolatum is often found in sandy soils and thrives in full sun.
